title: Business Live: Sterling gains as FTSE 100 closes down - BBC News
summary: millennium & copthorne hotels boosted by buyout offer .

text: the livepage is closing down earlier tonight due to staffing problems .
please join us again tomorrow at our usual time of 6am .
thanks for reading us .

documents.title: why we 're not rational
text: economics editor kamal ahmed tweets :
prof thaler 's central insight is that we are not the rational beings beloved of more traditional economic theory
a bid to convince sceptical americans of the value of driverless cars is being made by google 's parent company alphabet .

alphabet 's self-driving car unit waymo is teaming up with mothers against drunk driving , the national safety council , and the federation for blind children in a campaign called `` let 's talk self-driving '' .
the marketing campaign comes as congress considers how to regulate driverless car technology .
critics have been arguing that congress is moving too fast and not ensuring enough safeguards .
waymo chief executive john krafcik said in a blog post : `` there 's great enthusiasm and curiosity about self-driving cars - and there 's some confusion , too . ''
he added that the `` technology can help address some of the biggest safety challenges on our roads today '' .

documents.title: jigsaw pieces
text: telegraph retail editor ashley armstrong tweets :
2/2 below , a very rare political manifesto from a fashion brand .
jigsaw flying the flag for a `` vibrant , tolerant , global britain ''
nice one @ twitterid
love this .
thanks for sharing .
bold stance from jigsaw .
glad they have taken a stand
british fashion brand jigsaw wearing its heart on its sleeve in these turbulent times .
`` there 's no such thing as 100 % british '' it says 1/2

documents.title: two-year brexit transition 'assured '
text: theresa may has told business leaders that they should treat a two-year transition period after brexit as assured as she tries to ease concerns that the uk could crash out of the eu without a deal , reuters reports .

the prime minister met chief executives from glaxosmithkline , vodafone and hsbc and other major companies on monday to hear what they want from talks on britain 's relationship with the eu post-brexit .
businesses have become increasingly alarmed by the slow progress of negotiations and the prospect that the country could leave the eu without a new trading arrangement in place in 2019 .
`` from her point of view , the transitional agreement is non-negotiable business should think of the two-year period as assured .
it will happen , '' a source said .

a spokeswoman from mrs may 's office said she restated her position `` that the government 's goal is for a smooth , orderly exit in which there is only one set of changes for businesses and people '' .

documents.title: strike gets green light
text: workers at the driver and vehicle standards agency have voted to go on strike in a dispute over working time , travel and the introduction of new working practices .
members of the public and commercial services union ( pcs ) backed industrial action by 84 % , on a 70 % turnout .
the union said the vote sent a clear message that the dvsa must think again before `` forcing people to work longer , harder and for no pay '' .
pcs general secretary mark serwotka said : `` the actions of the department for transport in trying to force detrimental changes onto our members has backfired .
members have sent a clear signal that these changes are unacceptable .
it 's time now for ministers to listen to this result and scrap these plans . ''

documents.title: north sea oil find
text: statoil has reported that a new discovery in the north sea could contain up to 130 million barrels of oil .
the norwegian group said at least 25 million recoverable barrels had been proven in the immediate vicinity of the verbier sidetrack well in the outer moray firth .
it added there could be `` significant remaining potential '' in the basin .

documents.title: wall street update
text: wall street looks to be stagnating in early afternoon trading after getting off to a brisk - and another record-breaking - start .
the dow jones is now down 0.01 % at 22,770.6 points , the nasdaq is up 0.02 % at 6,591.5 , and the s & p 500 is down 0.05 % at 2,548 , which is just about 4 points shy of its record high .

documents.title: lvmh revenues jump
text: there 's no sign that the wealthy are tightening their belts if latest figures from the world 's biggest luxury goods company are a guide .
lvmh has just reported a 12 % rise in like-for-like revenues in the third quarter of 2017 , beating estimates after a strong showing from its clothing and leather goods division .
all divisions saw double-digit growth , except wines and spirits , which saw only a 4 % increase .
lvmh owns fashion brands such as louis vuitton and christian dior as well as moet & chandon champagne and hennessy cognac .

documents.title: royal mail : cwu union digs in
text: the cwu union says it will defend its royal mail members in the courts and in the workplace over plans to stage industrial action over pay and pensions .
`` we will defend our members through whatever means necessary , '' says cwu deputy general secretary terry pullinger .
the comments came as royal mail went to the high court on monday to halt a planned strike later this month .
mr pullinger said : our members voted by 9-to-1 to back their union .
this underhanded act from the employer is a deliberate attempt to misinterpret and use the agreement to stop postal workers exercising our right to strike and will only anger members further .
`` this union is not going away and will stand up for our members in the court room and in every workplace across the uk .
this dispute was never about christmas , it 's about protecting our members and this great public service and it will take as long as it takes .
we will defend our members through whatever means necessary . ''

documents.title: sterling gains ground as the ftse 100 closes down
text: the pound rose strongly , regaining some of the ground it lost last week .
sterling ended the day up 0.47 % against the dollar at $ 1.3130 and 0.42 % higher against the euro at €1.1184 .
sterling had hit a one-month dollar low on friday , amid uncertainty over theresa may 's future following the prime minister 's mishap-strewn speech at the conservative party conference .
as the pound rose , the ftse 100 share index slid 14.98 points to 7,507.89 .
the ftse 100 often falls when sterling rises , as the stronger currency cuts the value of companies ' overseas earnings when they are brought back to the uk and converted back into pounds .
shares in smith & nephew were among the biggest fallers on the index , down 1.5 % , after the medical devices maker said its chief executive , olivier bohuon , intended to retire by the end of 2018 .
on the ftse 250 , shares in hotels group millennium & copthorne jumped 22.9 % after singapore 's city developments offered to buy the remaining shares in m & c that it does not already own .
city developments already controls about 65 % of m & c .
the offer values the hotels group at about £ 1.8bn .

documents.title: real world economicseconomics nobel prize goes to us academic
text: how did prof. richard thaler 's 'nudge ' theory help keep toilets a little more sanitary ?
read more here .

documents.title: kpmg : another client drops the firm
text: south african retailer tfg has become the latest company to drop kpmg , the global accountancy firm ensnared in a scandal involving business friends of president jacob zuma , as its external auditor .
tfg cited `` concerns recently raised '' for its move .
kpmg 's own investigation had found flaws in work it did for the national tax agency and the gupta family , accused of using links with zuma to win government contracts .
the guptas and zuma deny wrongdoing and say they are victims of a politically motivated witch-hunt .

documents.title: unite wants bae job cut talks
text: britain 's largest union , unite , has issued a statement on growing fears that bae systems is about to cull 1,000 jobs .
nothing 's been confirmed , although the uk 's biggest defence firm could make an announcement tomorrow .

unite assistant general secretary steve turner says : the uk government can end the uncertainty surrounding the future of thousands of british bae defence jobs at a stroke by committing to building the next-generation fighter jets here in the uk .
bae must also come clean on its plans .
unite is demanding urgent discussions with the company .

if these job cuts materialise it will significantly undermine our nation 's sovereign defence capability and leave us reliant on foreign powers and foreign companies for the successor to the typhoon and the defence of the nation .

once these jobs are gone , they are gone for a generation and with them the skills and ability to control our own defence and manufacture the next generation of fighter jets and other defence equipment in the uk . ''
the ripple effects down the supply chain would be immense , mr turner adds .

documents.title: price war to blame
text: chris grayling has said that brexit did not play a part in monarch 's collapse , as some labour and snp politicians have claimed :
this summer 's price war completely undermined the company 's revenue transport secretary , chris grayling , on demise of monarch

documents.title: grayling mulls changes
text: more on the transport secretary 's commons statement on monarch from personal finance correspondent simon gompertz :
grayling says looking if possible for an airline to wind down in orderly manner + look after customers without need for govt to step in
grayling `` engaged with credit and debit card providers to see if we can recoup from them some of the cost of these repatriation flights ''

documents.title: breaking75 % of monarch passengers back
text: about 80,000 monarch passengers who were abroad when the airline went bust have returned to the uk , chris grayling has said .
the transport secretary told the commons this represents almost 75 % of the 110,000 passengers affected by the largest airline failure in uk history .
mr grayling revealed the latest figures as he updated mps about monarch 's collapse , adding that the event was `` hugely distressing '' .
the government is now seeking redress from the airline 's creditors for the cost of the repatriation flights .

documents.title: arm hires 1,000 after softbank deal
text: uk chip designer arm holdings has brought in an extra 1,000 staff since japan 's softbank bought it for £ 24bn a year ago .
to help clear the deal , the japanese firm promised to more than double arm 's staff over the course of five years .
arm designs chip technology used in apple and samsung smartphones , and is one of britain 's biggest tech companies .

a report prepared by softbank for the uk takeover panel has shown that staff numbers grew from 1,749 to 2,173 in the uk in the year since the deal , while overseas employees have increased from 2,220 to 2,845 .
author: Dan Macadam
BBC business reporter

documents.title: not so great wall
text: you may remember a few weeks ago the car industry got very excited that china 's great wall motor had supposedly expressed interest in buying some or all of fiat chrysler - its jeep brand in particular .
no actual bid had been forthcoming , however , and chief executive sergio marchionne says today he is not sure that such a deal would be welcome .
he says there are `` sensitive issues associated with trans-national mergers '' that have not been thought through yet .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: air berlin braced for landing
text: air berlin , the bankrupt german airline , is preparing to end flights by the end of october .
in a letter to employees , it said flights under the code ab will `` no longer be possible after october 28 at the latest '' , german media reported .
flights operated by subsidiaries niki and lg walter , which are not insolvent , will continue .
air berlin collapsed in august following years of losses and the decision of its biggest shareholder , gulf airline etihad , to cease financing .
it is in talks with lufthansa and easyjet about selling parts of its business .

documents.title: debit card spending overseas dropsbbc report kevin peachey tweets :
text: what debit card spending tells us about our summer holidays @ twitterid

documents.title: the bull continues running
text: us stocks inched higher at the start of trading , with the dow and the nasdaq hitting fresh records , on rising optimism over president donald trump 's proposed tax overhaul .
the dow jones rose 7.43 points , or 0.03 % , to 22,781.1 .
the s & p 500 gained 2.06 points , or 0.08 % , to 2,551.39 .
the nasdaq added 7.26 points , or 0.11 % , to 6,597.44 .

documents.title: listen : why is the gender gap in economics widening ?
text: today 's economics nobel prize went to richard thaler , but there were rumours a women would win the award .
it would have been beacon in a profession where the number of women studying economics is falling .
the bbc 's kim gittleson reports on why fewer women are studying the subject .

documents.title: bae : jobs cut news may be imminent
text: our colleagues in lancashire , where bae systems has two big factories , have a few more details on speculation the defence giant is planning 1,000 job cuts .
the bbc understands an announcement is expected on tuesday .
john cameron , deputy chairman of unite , said the union was concerned about a `` lack of work going forward '' .
more than 9,000 people are employed at the sites , in warton and samlesbury .
bae is yet to make a specific announcement , but a spokesman said the business `` continually reviews its operations to make sure we are performing as effectively and efficiently as possible '' .

documents.title: revolution bars wants cash
text: revolution bars has rebuffed last week 's all-share merger proposal from unwanted suitor deltic group and called for the nightclub owner to make a cash offer instead .
`` the board encourages deltic to make a cash offer for revolution rather than continuing to focus on its current merger proposal , '' it said in a stock exchange statement .
revolution shareholders are already due to meet next week to vote on a rival cash offer of 203p per share from slug and lettuce owner stonegate pubs .

documents.title: royal mail goes to court
text: royal mail says it will formally lodge a court application today to stop industrial action .
the company set 12 noon as a deadline for the cwu union to withdraw plans to strike .
`` cwu has declined to withdraw its notification , '' royal mail said in a statement .
workers are set to strike for 48 hours from 19 october in a dispute over pensions , pay and jobs .
but the company says the cwu had signed up to a legally-binding mediation process to resolve disputes , and has not followed this procedure .
royal mail said : `` we believe any strike action before the dispute resolution procedures have been followed would be unlawful strike action .

`` royal mail notes that , in a ballot in 2014 on all the provisions of the agenda for growth agreement including the dispute resolution procedures , 94.5 % of cwu members that cast their votes voted yes . ''

documents.title: sterling continues to strengthen
text: the pound 's rise this morning has continued .
it 's now up 0.8 % against both the dollar and the euro at $ 1.31750 and €1.12220 respectively .
the rise has helped the pound to recover some of the 2.5 % it lost last week , which was the pound 's biggest weekly drop in a year .
will it continue to strengthen ?
paresh davdra , chief executive of rationalfx , says it all depends what happens this afternoon .
`` with pm may expected to offer a special partnership between the uk and the eu , the key driver for sterling today will be the eu 's response to may 's offer , '' he says .

- richard thaler on whether or not he will act 'humanly ' in spending the prize money .

documents.title: theresa may to meet firms later
text: downing street has announced that after the pm 's statement in the house of commons later , it will release two white papers covering future trade and customs options .
after her speech , mrs may will also meet with leading industry figures to try and reassure them about the brexit process .

companies including aston martin , hsbc , morgan stanley and vodafone will attend the meeting of the business advisory council in downing street , alongside chancellor philip hammond and david davis .

documents.title: not just a pointy-head economistuniversity of chicago professor wins nobel prize for economics
text: richard thaler is not just a brilliant economist , he 's also a film star ( well , may be that 's pushing it ) and a successful investor .
the professor had a cameo in the oscar-nominated `` the big short '' , explaining the role of behavioural economics in contributing to the financial crash .
if you need a refresher on synthetic collateralised debt obligations , there 's a clip on youtube .

meanwhile , thaler 's academic work forms the basis of the undiscovered managers behavioral value fund , owned by jpmorgan chase , an investment vehicle whose value has doubled in the last couple of years .

documents.title: ftse 's fall deepens
text: it still has n't moved a great deal , but this morning 's fall in the ftse 100 has deepened slightly .
it 's now down 20 points , or 0.3 % at 7,503.14 .
easyjet is currently the biggest faller , down 2 % after hsbc cut its target price on the budget airline .

`` the ftse has had a pretty good rally , it 's verging on overbought now so it might just be a little bit of short-term weariness , '' says ian williams , economics and strategy analyst at peel hunt .

documents.title: brexit 'ball is in the uk 's court '
text: prime minister theresa may is due to issue a statement to the house of commons later on how brexit talks are progressing .
margaritis schinas - spokesman for the european commission - suggested that so far there 's been little progress .
`` there has been so far no solution found on step one , which is the divorce proceedings , so the ball is entirely in the uk court for the rest to happen . ''
the fifth round of brexit negotiations begins at 13:00 bst with a technical meeting of officials .

documents.title: another reason to expect a rate rise ? ons admits mistake in data on labour market costs
text: some red faces at the office for national statistics this morning .

in a correction to figures it released last week , the uk 's official statistical body said it had made an error in calculating what are called unit labour costs '' - the amount firms spend employing people including pay , taxes and benefits for every unit of wealth ( productivity ) created .
rather than labour costs rising by 1.6 % as the ons originally reported , costs are actually up 2.4 % .
it appears that the ons was originally relying on out of date data which it revised over the weekend after the mistake was pointed out by the economist , simon ward .
this matters because rising labour costs mean that businesses are spending more to create wealth - there is a larger percentage increase in costs per hour than output per hour .
that affects economic growth , eats into profits and threatens wage rises ( if a company is making less money it tends to increase prices to us , the consumer , and restrict pay increases ) .
if business costs are rising , that also increases inflationary pressure .
which will feed into the bank of england 's calculations on whether to increase interest rates at its next rate meeting on november 2 .
many will argue that increasing labour costs will make a rate rise more likely .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

text: the bbc 's economics editor kamal ahmed is back after a three-month break writing a book

documents.title: ecb seeks 'intense discussions '
text: the european central bank has said that some 51 banks may need to set aside more capital to make sure they can cope with a hike in interest rates .
the central bank tested 111 banks to see how well prepared they are for a potential hike .
its conclusion is that it needs to have `` intense discussions '' with 51 of them to make them aware of the risks .

`` what we need to do is have intense discussions and check with the banks if they 're aware of the risk and if they have enough capital if things go wrong , '' korbinian ibel , a senior supervisor at the ecb , said .

documents.title: thaler wins economics nobel
text: in a statement , per strömberg , of the royal swedish academy of sciences , said thaler had contributed to an understanding of the psychology of economics .

`` for the last four decades he has used both theories and conception models , lab experiments , empirical tests and surveys to document and analyse how specific aspects of human psychology systematically shape economic decisions .

`` richard thaler 's findings have inspired many other researchers coming in his footsteps and it has paved the way for a new field in economics which we call behavioural economics , '' mr strömberg said .

documents.title: breaking'nudge ' theorist thaler wins nobel economics prize
text: richard thaler has won the 2017 nobel economics prize .
he is regarded as one of the founding fathers of behaviourial economics and decision-making .
the university of chicago professor is co-author , with cass sunstein of nudge : improving decisions about health , wealth and happiness .
his most recent work is : misbehaving : the making of behavioral economics
the award is not one of the prizes that alfred nobel established in his will in 1895 , although laureates are announced at broadly the same time as those for other disciplines .
and the winners receive the award at the same ceremony .
the economics award is officially known as the sveriges riksbank prize in economic sciences in memory of alfred nobel .

documents.title: bae job cuts ?
text: there are reports this morning that defence giant bae systems plans to announce 1,000 job cuts this week .
bae is not confirming anything , although its statement to the bbc hardly seems like a firm denial .
here it is in full :

bae systems continually reviews its operations to make sure we are performing as effectively and efficiently as possible , delivering our commitments to existing customers and ensuring we are best placed to secure future business .
`` if and when there are any changes proposed we are committed to communicating with our employees and their representatives first . ''

documents.title: the engineers training for hs2bbc producer kate mcgough tweets :
text: the engineers training for hs2bbc producer kate mcgough tweets :

documents.title: ons issues a correction
text: there 's been a lot of speculation about a mistake that the office for national statistics made in friday 's labour productivity report .
the figure is a key metric watched by bank of england policy makers when making decisions on interest rates .
the ons has now issued a correction .
it says :
`` earnings and other labour costs growth outpaced productivity growth , resulting in unit labour cost ( ulc ) growth of 2.4 % in the year to quarter 2 2017 . ''
that 's up from a previous estimate of 1.6 % .
it attributes the mistake to income data from the second estimate of gdp being using instead of data from quarterly national accounts '' .

documents.title: angling direct reels in sales
text: in case you missed it earlier , fishing equipment retailer angling direct has reported its first results since listing on junior stock market aim earlier this year .
revenues were up an impressive 40 % to £ 14m for the first half of this year .
however , pre-tax profit fell to £ 86,000 from £ 438,000 for the same period last year .
the fall was mainly due to exceptional costs relating to the aim listing which came to £ 623,000 .

documents.title: petra diamonds warns on loan
text: one of africa 's largest diamond mining companies is in financial trouble .
petra diamonds , which has operations in south africa and tanzania , says it 's likely to breach the terms of its loans by the end of the year .
the bbc 's africa business report editor matthew davies says it 's the result of a `` double whammy for petra '' .
`` it 's been hit by labour disputes at its mines in south africa and tighter regulations in tanzania .
`` industrial action has disrupted production , even though a three-year wage deal was signed last week .
`` and early last month , officials in tanzania seized a parcel of diamonds from the williamson mine , claiming it was undervalued . ''

documents.title: weinstein sacking 'a landmark '
text: the ousting of one of the most powerful men in hollywood is a major moment , according to feminist author naomi wolf .
harvey weinstein was sacked by the board of his company following allegations of sexual harassment .
the 65-year old oscar-winning producer - behind films including shakespeare in love and the king 's speech - has apologised , but his lawyer rejected many of the allegations .

ms wolf told the bbc : `` it 's notable that he was actually fired by his company because i ca n't think of many powerful men who have experienced even minor professional setbacks even after well-documented decades of abuse of women .
`` it 's definitely a landmark in penalties for this kind of eruption of testimony . ''
but she criticised media coverage of the story , saying that use of phrases like `` inappropriate behaviour '' played down the gravity of the allegations .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: 'in your face '
text: the nobel prize for economics - the last in the line of this year 's prestigious awards - is due to be announced today and there is talk it could go to a woman for only the second time in its history .
one avid nobel-watcher is predicting that french economist esther duflo could win it for her work on global poverty .
the professor , 44 , is also reportedly a keen rock climber and once told the new yorker that she was `` efficient '' and `` a little in-your-face '' but not very funny .
looking forward to the acceptance speech already .
though , of course there 's no certainty that this will be her year .
until the 10.30am announcement lots of names are still in the running .
american elinor ostrom was the first woman to receive the accolade in 2009 .

documents.title: less than three months to christmasbbc 's rory cellan-jones tweets :
text: got out of the tube to a horrific sight - it 's october 9th !
christmas should not jump ahead of halloween and guy fawkes .
`` dexit ''
wrong in every way there should be a law no christ as until after halloween at the earliest
but rory , anything for children !
; d
late to the party here , rory : john lewis had christmas music playing on the 1st oct and these decorations started going up on tuesday
you 're not wrong : they have n't even started on the halloween decorations !
bought my first mince pies at the weekend !
a firm favourite with the children .
shudders

documents.title: pound edges higher
text: the pound is staging something of a comeback this morning .
it 's currently up 0.35 % against the dollar and 0.41 % against the euro at €1.118 .
spreadex analyst connor campbell says the fact that nothing dramatic happened over the weekend despite reports of infighting among the top conservative party members appears to have helped sterling .

`` of course , in the context of the last few weeks , sterling is still struggling ; the fact it has ( so far ) started the week on the right foot , however , is an important step on its potential road to recovery , '' he says .

documents.title: statoil surprise
text: norwegian energy giant statoil has announced that a new discovery in the north sea could contain in the range of 25 to 130 million barrels of oil .
the group said the find , in the verbier sidetrack well in the outer moray firth , is proof that `` there could be significant remaining potential '' in the basin .

documents.title: millennium & copthorne up 21 %
text: one firm managing to shrug off the general market malaise is millennium & copthorne ( m & c ) .
the hotel group 's shares are up 21 % after its singaporean majority owner offered to buy the remaining shares of the uk-listed group in a deal that values it at around £ 1.8bn .
city developments is offering m & c shareholders 552.5p in cash for each share .
that represents a premium of about 21.4 % to m & c 's closing share price on friday .
the directors of m & c said they considered the terms of the offer to be fair and reasonable .

documents.title: ftse 100 flat
text: the ftse 100 is as lacklustre as today 's weather .
so far it 's slipped 5.7 points to 7,517.17 .
medical equipment manufacturer smith & nephew is the biggest faller .
its shares are down 1.3 % after it announced that chief executive olivier bohuon is retiring at the end of next year .

documents.title: china stocks rise
text: investors pushed chinese shares higher on monday as trading resumed after a week-long break .
bank stocks were among the big movers as investors played catch-up with gains across global markets while they were shut .
shanghai composite index jumped 1.2 % while the smaller shenzen composite jumped 1.5 % .
elsewhere in asia , hong kong 's hang seng slipped 0.3 % in afternoon trading , while australia 's s & p/asx 200 put on 0.5 % .
markets in japan and south korea were closed for holidays .

documents.title: wood group deal done
text: wood group 's £ 2.2bn takeover of amec foster wheeler is now officially complete .
the firms agreed to sell a range of assets after the competition markets authority ( cma ) found the merger could curb competition in the supply of services to the uk oil industry .
wood group boss robin watson says it 's a `` transformational '' deal which will create `` a global leader '' .

documents.title: lord mayor 's swansong
text: amid all the discussion of which european capitals will benefit if brexit causes financial services firms to relocate some business outside london , the city 's lord mayor , andrew parmley , is busy swimming upstream .

he says he 's `` not worried '' about the city 's future role and that as long as a clear message on transition comes through before the end of the year - which he 's `` very hopeful '' about - then london will keep its role as europe 's leading financial center he suggests .

but while he seemed to glide along calmly on radio 4 's today programme you get the impression there is a certain amount of frantic paddling going on under the water to try to ensure these predictions come true .
he is visiting dublin today and tomorrow to strengthen ties between the uk and ireland '' .
and before his year-long term ends next month he 'll make a final visit to belfast .

documents.title: do you only shop online ?
text: britain 's biggest property owner predicts the death of shops , so how much shopping do you do online ?
we 'll discuss at 0830 on # bbcbizlive
one can not try on on-line .
every time i 'm in the post office there are at least 3 people returning garments .
that says it all !
yes best try-on sally .
also , one will miss bargains ( further reductions 'one-offs ' and damaged/window dressing garments ) if not in the shop !
turn high streets into housing then
yes .
there should at least be a forward plan on how to convert and use .
online provides discounted price & time saving from traveling .
but best fit you get in direct shopping .
i do as much as possible online ; i hate having to physically go to the shops .
he forgets the fact that people enjoy it !
probably 95 % .
easier & cheaper .
surely double edged sword for s/mkts .
you 'd never try anything new , just get favs .
no end of aisle temptations
at least 95 %
i loath purchasing any clothing item online .
you can never ever beat actually trying something on , to both see and feel how it really fits .
90 % online - still go to westend for my clothes

documents.title: german factory orders 'solid '
text: while germany 's industrial production figures for august were strong , pantheon macroeconomics says they were flattered by base effects .
`` a solid report , but we are not that impressed by the upside surprise relative to forecasters ' expectations , '' it says .
pantheon says german industrial production is now growing between 4 % to 5 % a year , a number which it expects to increase in the short term .

documents.title: wages stagnatingeef tells wake up to money
text: there 's expectation next year that wages will up but those forecasts have been frustrated again and again '' @ twitterid tells # wakeuptomoney

documents.title: trinity mirror 'good progress '
text: trinity mirror says it 's made `` good progress '' in the third quarter of this year .
revenues were down 8 % for the period , just slightly better than the 9 % fall the group saw for the first half of the year .
it 's revealing little about its talks with daily express and daily star owner northern & shell , simply saying `` the group continues to make progress '' .
`` further updates will be made when appropriate , '' it says .

documents.title: german factory orders jump
text: german industrial production jumped more than expected in august , posting its biggest monthly increase in more than six years .
industrial output increased by 2.6 % on the month in august after edging down by 0.1 % in july , data from the economy ministry showed .
the number easily beat forecasts for a 0.7 % rise and suggests germany is set for solid third quarter growth .

documents.title: catalonia debate incomplete
text: the furore over last week 's disputed independence referendum in catalonia continued over the weekend .
spanish pm mariano rajoy has warned he would not rule out anything `` within the law '' to halt catalan secession .
dr rafael hortala-vallve - associate professor at the london school of economics - says there 's still yet to be a debate about what would happen if catalonia did get independence .
`` we really do n't know how viable it is .
at least with brexit and scotland [ referendums ] there was a debate about the viability of the two options , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: rate rise could be 'mistake '
text: recent economic data for the uk including car sales and manufacturing have been weaker , leading to questions over whether the uk economy could handle an interest rate hike .
but mike bell , global market strategist at jp morgan asset management says the bank has `` talked itself '' into a rate hike .
`` ultimately it may end up being a mistake .
`` they may be able to put up rates once or maybe twice but this is n't the start of a rate hiking cycle , '' he says .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: new look trying to cut debt
text: reports suggest that high street fashion chain new look is set for crunch talks with its lenders after a collapse in profits this year .
brait capital , which bought new look two years ago , is in talks with debt restructuring advisers to cut the chain 's £ 1.2bn debt pile , according to the times .
hargreaves lansdown analyst laith khalaf says it 's a tough time for consumer spending with the fall in the pound hitting retailers ' costs .
meanwhile , he points out that inflation is rising and wages are not keeping up .
`` consumers are directing their spending at their essentials and not on unnecessary items , '' he says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: trinity mirror trading update due
text: trinity mirror , which is currently in talks to buy the owner of the daily express and daily star , has a trading update out this morning .
former manchester evening news editor paul horrocks says all the focus will be on how talks on the deal are progressing .
`` plurality of voice is really important and it 's important that the express voice is n't sucked into the mirror voice , '' he says .
he says assuming the deal goes ahead the editorial functions of the titles will need to be kept separate even if back office functions , such as accounting and marketing , are merged .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: time for a rate rise ?
text: the bank of england has given fairly strong hints that an interest rate rise is finally on the cards , with governor mark carney suggesting a move could come at the monetary policy committee 's next meeting on 2 november .
but is now the right timing ?
economist bronwyn curtis , most recently head of global research at hsbc , says yes .
`` a couple of rate hikes would help balance things out .
there will be consequences if we let debt build up , if things do n't get back to normal , '' she says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: hs2 college opens
text: construction on hs2 , the new high-speed rail network , from london to birmingham and to manchester and leeds , is due to start in two years .

today a new national training college - the national college for high speed rail - is opening to deal with the uk 's skills shortage for major infrastructure projects and try to make sure the project has the necessary engineers .
is n't it too little too late ?
clair mowbray , chief executive of the new college , says in fact it 's perfect timing .
`` by doing it now , a couple of years out from them starting construction , we 're making sure they 've got the engineers on time , '' she says .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: harvey weinstein ousted
text: harvey weinstein , the film producer accused of sexually harassing female employees for nearly three decades , was fired by the firm late last night .
the weinstein company directors said that `` in light of new information about misconduct '' , they had terminated mr weinstein 's employment `` effective immediately '' .
the departure leaves weinstein 's brother bob , a co-chairman , and chief operating officer david glasser at the helm of the company .

documents.title: good morning
text: hello
there 's a big brexit focus this morning .
theresa may is meeting the business advisory council to talk over the brexit plans while the fifth round of talks on the uk 's withdrawal from the eu will start today and continue all week .
on a less heavy note blade runner 2049 disappointed at the weekend , making $ 31.5m on its opening weekend which is well below the $ 45m forecast .
analysts say its near three-hour long running time may have put people off .

and in other news this is the last week to spend your old pound coins , but in a move that the royal mint says will cause chaos some shops have said they 'll continue to accept the coins even after they are no longer legal tender .
